article.Heading: Budget 2016: HPCL, IOC, BPCL fall 2-3% on likely hike in crude import duty
article.Summary: Analysts say if the government re-imposes 5 percent customs duty on crude (which is currently zero) then it would be negative for OMCs and positive for upstream companies.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

Shares of oil marketing companies (OMC - BPCL, HPCL, IOC) declined 2-3 percent intraday Monday ahead of Budget 2016 as the government is likely to impose customs duty on crude.

Analysts say if the government re-imposes 5 percent customs duty on crude (which is currently zero) then it would be negative for OMCs and positive for upstream companies.

Nomura expects some relief for upstream companies (ONGC and Oil India) from a reduction in production cess rate (currently Rs 4,500/tonne) and/or imposition of import duty on crude oil (currently zero).

It also expects additional initiatives to reduce fuel under-recoveries such as income-based restriction on direct benefit transfer for LPG, roll-out of direct benefit transfer for kerosene subsidy, etc. It expects initiatives such as removal of excise duty on compressed natural gas (CNG) and removal of import duty on LNG to promote gas infrastructure development in the country.

At 10:32 hours IST, the scrip of Bharat Petroleum Corporation fell 2.6 percent to Rs 746.45, Hindustan Petroleum Corporation declined 1.37 percent to Rs 652 and Indian Oil Corporation shed 1.06 percent to Rs 360.20 on the BSE.
